programName: Bioengineering/Materials Science and Engineering Joint Major (B.S.)
fullProgramDescription: The Bioengineering/Materials Science and Engineering Joint Major is an undergraduate program that combines the fields of bioengineering and materials science and engineering. Students in this program gain a strong foundation in the principles of both fields and develop the ability to apply this knowledge to solve complex problems at the interface of biology, medicine, and materials science.
shortProgramDescription: The Bioengineering/Materials Science and Engineering Joint Major program provides students with a comprehensive education in the principles of bioengineering and materials science and engineering.
classHighlights: The program requires a set of core courses in bioengineering, including Introduction to Bioengineering (BIO ENG 101), Biomechanics (BIO ENG 103), and Bioengineering Seminar (BIO ENG 192).

Students also complete a series of core courses in materials science and engineering, including Introduction to Materials Science and Engineering (MAT SCI 45), Materials Science and Engineering Laboratory (MAT SCI 102), and Thermodynamics of Materials (MAT SCI 204).
Additional required courses include Chemistry (CHEM 1A, 1B), Physics (PHYSICS 7A, 7B), Mathematics (MATH 1A, 1B), and Biology (BIOLOGY 1A, 1B).
Students also choose from a range of electives in both bioengineering and materials science and engineering, allowing them to tailor their education to their interests and career goals.
learningOutcomes: Apply fundamental principles of bioengineering and materials science and engineering to solve complex problems.
Design and conduct experiments to test hypotheses and solve problems.
Analyze and interpret data from experiments and simulations.
Communicate complex ideas and results effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Work effectively in teams to solve problems and complete projects.
Understand the ethical and societal implications of their work.
creditRequirements: Total of approximately 120-128 semester credits, including major requirements and breadth courses
additionalInformation: The program is designed for students who are interested in pursuing a career at the interface of bioengineering and materials science and engineering. Students are encouraged to participate in research and internships to gain practical experience.
